item.title: Java [Beginner Tutorials]
item.dc:creator: @sssylasss sssylasss
item.description:
@sssylasss wrote:

[quote=“Omer_, post:6, topic:446250”][quote author=sssylasss link=topic=549096.msg4025840#msg4025840 date=1340322271]

should make a java guide that isn’t what all the rest are, no one is really going to learn anything from the helloworld application because they didnt do it themself, and all they learned was to outprint a message to the cmd. I would suggest moving into other things such as arrays, linkedlists, for loops, and if-else statements.

i’m going to add them later

Don’t worry, he’s just trying to sound smart.

So your saying this tutorial would be useful to people?

What’s the point of learning about Collections, conditionals, and loops if you don’t know how to print output to the screen?

because its useless to just show the tutorial everyone has read 100 times before, Its the first tutorial on the oracle website and should have already read it if you are trying to work with RSPS, I know not everyone has read it, but even still your not going to get far reading a hello world tutorial.
[/quote]

Well, this is a beginner tutorial, is it not? The Hello World program is a traditional starting point for new programmers.
Also, no, no one here has read the tutorials on the Oracle website. With the exception of few, they’re all fucking idiots that could give 2 shits about learning how to legitimately program but instead care only about “coding” their cool new PI server.
And if you don’t feel that anyone’s going to get far learning about Hello World, then go ahead and write a tutorial that teaches beginner programmers about collections when they don’t even know how to print to stdout. Be my guest.[/quote]
I guess that is true, but I still think this is a useless post, the sticky in this forum has a link to the official java tutorials which would be much more useful. http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,436613.0.html

Read full topic

item.title: Java [Beginner Tutorials]
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“Native^, post:16, topic:446237”][quote author=justaguy link=topic=549096.msg4025501#msg4025501 date=1340309548]

the System.out.println() tells java to output (or .out) and to print on a new line (or println) what ever is given next in this case it would print Hello World!

you got that very wrong

Print a String and then terminate the line. This method behaves as though it invokes print(String) and then println().

you didn’t explain the basics of switch statements seeing as of SE7 you can use strings. You also failed to do anything with if/else statements besides work with integers which is hardly covering basics.

your examples could also be better rewritten

[hr]

this thread is exactly why there shouldn’t be tutorials in this section

I made this fast i’ll fix my errors, in fact i’ll put together a better tutorial

Don’t even bother making tutorials if you aren’t going to put effort in them.
[/quote]
Don’t bother posting if you have nothing positive to say.[/quote]

Max CB - 200

Uhm, this is horrible. Imagine you want to train on bandits, and you get no experience…

Take that hypocritical mentality somewhere else.

Read full topic

item.title: Java [Beginner Tutorials]
item.dc:creator: @Wank Broham
item.description:
@Wank wrote:

[quote=“Omer_, post:3, topic:446250”][quote author=Serravalle link=topic=549096.msg4025535#msg4025535 date=1340310755]
A hello world program is the most basic thing, and is the first thing learned when you start to program. Documenting your name, and who the author is in a Hello World program is absurd.

Hello World in Java
Now that you know the basic structure of a java file

You didn’t decipher what the basic structure of a java file is at all. You should amend certain parts of your thread, you’re missing a lot of the basic information. Also, work on your conventions, use notepad++ or auto indentation under the refactor tab on eclipse.
[/quote]

Source -> Format*
And documentation is never absurd. It’s a good habit to get into.[/quote]

I personally document everything I write and I put my author credits, etc but documenting a hello world program is inane and redudant as it’s functions are obvious.

Read full topic

item.title: Java [Beginner Tutorials]
item.dc:creator: @Wank Broham
item.description:
@Wank wrote:

A hello world program is the most basic thing, and is the first thing learned when you start to program. Documenting your name, and who the author is in a Hello World program is absurd.

[quote=“Bubbler, post:1, topic:446237”]Hello World in Java
Now that you know the basic structure of a java file[/quote]

You didn’t decipher what the basic structure of a java file is at all. You should amend certain parts of your thread, you’re missing a lot of the basic information. Also, work on your conventions, use notepad++ or *source—>format on eclipse.

Read full topic

item.title: Java [Beginner Tutorials]
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:15, topic:446237”][quote author=Bubbler link=topic=549096.msg4025404#msg4025404 date=1340304194]

the System.out.println() tells java to output (or .out) and to print on a new line (or println) what ever is given next in this case it would print Hello World!

you got that very wrong

Print a String and then terminate the line. This method behaves as though it invokes print(String) and then println().

you didn’t explain the basics of switch statements seeing as of SE7 you can use strings. You also failed to do anything with if/else statements besides work with integers which is hardly covering basics.

your examples could also be better rewritten

[hr]

this thread is exactly why there shouldn’t be tutorials in this section

I made this fast i’ll fix my errors, in fact i’ll put together a better tutorial
[/quote]

Don’t even bother making tutorials if you aren’t going to put effort in them.[/quote]
Don’t bother posting if you have nothing positive to say.

Read full topic
